item.title: iOS async revisited
item.description: In this post weare going to look as async again, but from the perspective of F#. Xamarin Evolve 2013 I have been watching the Xamarin Evolve conference this week and it was good to see Miguel announce full support for F#. Those that follow me on twitter etc, will know that I have been doing F# for quite a while in MonoDevelop and Xamarin Studio. The new support currently entails some new project templates so that you can easily create epic new F# Apps without having to refer to my blog.

item.title: A little bit of iOS async
item.description: I was going to title this post as ‘Now for something completely different’ but felt that a little bit too Pythonesque, and when I thought about it a bit it isn’t really completely just slightly different, namely C# rather than my usual F# posts. Right, enough of the waffling, this post is a little tour into the relatively unknown area of async on iOS. Xamarin announced the alpha preview of async await on March 11th this year (2013).
